con:interface.name: Authorize
con:interface.con:description: Authorize is our implementation of the OAuth 2.0 framework. It enables secure authorization using standard methods that can easily be integrated in your app. If you're familiar with OAuth 2.0, everything should look familiar. If not, you may want to check out the OAuth 2.0 resources <a target="_blank" href="https://oauth.net/2/">here</a>.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
To retrieve an authorization code, call the authorize endpoint by passing the required query parameters.You should end up with a relative URL similar to the below (illustrative).

/authCode/oauth2/authorize?response_type=code&client_id=[Your client_id issued to you during app registration]&scope=[Space delimited scopes selected from the table below. Only request the scopes required for your app to work.]&countryCode=US&businessCode=GCB&locale=en_US&state=[The state value you create and will verify]&redirect_uri=[The redirect_uri you registered during app registration].

Your final URL should look similar to this, go ahead a try it in any browser if you are unsure if you formed it properly:

https://sandbox.apihub.citi.com/gcb/api/authCode/oauth2/authorize?response_type=code&client_id=97086fae-c252-4d81-b4d9-d73cde5ea800&scope=accounts_details_transactions customers_profiles&countryCode=US&businessCode=GCB&locale=en_US&state=12093&redirect_uri=https://www.test.com

ScopeDescription
pay_with_pointsManage Pay with Points enrollment, look up rewards balances and complete redemptions
accounts_details_transactionsRetrieve a summary of all accounts, account details and transactions
customers_profilesRetrieve profile data such as name, email address and home address
payeesRetrieve payees/source accounts for all accounts
personal_domestic_transfersRetrieve payees/source accounts and complete transfers between your own Citi accounts in the same market
internal_domestic_transfersRetrieve payees/source accounts and complete transfers from your Citi accounts to other customer Citi accounts in the same market
external_domestic_transfersRetrieve payees/source accounts and complete transfers from your Citi accounts to other bank accounts in the same market
bill_paymentsRetrieve bill payees and complete bill payments
cardsRetrieve card IDs and update configurations such as overseas usage and configurations
onboardingCreate and manage customer applications and prospects
reference_dataRetrieve valid values for certain fields. Simplifies multi market app development

For successful request, citi will return a login page which allows customers to enter their credentials.

Use any of the following credentials.

S.NoUsernamePassword
1SandboxUser1P@ssUser1$
2SandboxUser2P@ssUser2$
3SandboxUser3P@ssUser3$
4SandboxUser4P@ssUser4$
5SandboxUser5P@ssUser5$

Once credentials are verified, a consent page will be presented to the Citi customer to approve the scope requested by your app. After getting customer consent, the flow redirects to the provided redirect_uri and an authorization code will be sent back as a query component.

https://www.test.com/?code=`AAJP_jIlIuuIqS-qj0ohfXLaOyhQK9y4bbyhEJWt39l5gWT-1XZmCHtESO2gcbLsPmLlERAAPj80IfLueI4WM8s_Ay1Gy8VtcwFUv8lQE4Svi9hOayu5kBP2OKLhvBwMwrZ_wz5SDHaKN96BdgScYmNEGww0IcV5gH4VBjeOPijN7CxdMRwc2H_w5RnpckbCtS4605BCp5FD0Qho4tYsfcmJ&state=12093

This authorization code is valid for a very short period of time and should be immediately exchanged for access token.

Authorization code grant: Retrieve authorization code

con:parameter.con:name: response_type
con:parameter.con:description: Value MUST be set to "code"

con:parameter.con:name: client_id
con:parameter.con:description: Client ID generated during application registration.

con:parameter.con:name: scope
con:parameter.con:description: The set of scopes required to make the API calls. Scope is case insensitive and multiple values can be passed using space delimiter.

con:parameter.con:name: countryCode
con:parameter.con:description: Country code in 2 character ISO 3166 format

con:parameter.con:name: businessCode
con:parameter.con:description: The 3 character business code. Use GCB for consumer banking

con:parameter.con:name: locale
con:parameter.con:description: Locale identify a specific language and geographic region, it shoule follow [language[_territory]. eg - en_US, en_SG

con:parameter.con:name: state
con:parameter.con:description: Opaque value to maintain the state between request and call back. This will be used to prevent cross-site request forgery.

con:parameter.con:name: redirect_uri
con:parameter.con:description: Absolute uri for user-agent redirection.You should provide the uri used during client registration process.

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: If your access token has expired and you still have a valid refresh token, you can exchange it for a new set of valid access and refresh tokens. Authorization code grant: Refresh access token

con:parameter.con:name: Authorization
con:parameter.con:description: HTTP Basic authentication by passing base64 encoded value of the client id and client secret separated by colon (:).Example: Base64(client_id:client_secret) will be passed as Basic KGNsaWVudF9pZDpjbGllbnRfc2VjcmV0KQ==

con:parameter.con:name: Content-Type
con:parameter.con:description: Content type. Value is application/x-www-form-urlencoded

con:parameter.con:name: grant_type
con:parameter.con:description: The grant type. Valid value is refresh_token.

con:parameter.con:name: refresh_token
con:parameter.con:description: The refresh token issued to the client

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: The revoke call will terminate the access granted by citi customer to your application. Authorization code grant: Revoke access

con:parameter.con:name: Authorization
con:parameter.con:description: HTTP Basic authentication by passing base64 encoded value of the client id and client secret separated by colon (:).Example: Base64(client_id:client_secret) will be passed as Basic KGNsaWVudF9pZDpjbGllbnRfc2VjcmV0KQ==

con:parameter.con:name: Content-Type
con:parameter.con:description: Content type. Value is application/x-www-form-urlencoded

con:parameter.con:name: token
con:parameter.con:description: The token to be revoked

con:parameter.con:name: token_type_hint
con:parameter.con:description: A hint about the type of the token submitted for revocation. Clients MAY pass this parameter in order to help the authorization server to optimize the token lookup. Valid values are access_token, refresh_token

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description:
Get an access token issued by calling our token endpoint and passing the authorization code from the previous call. The issued access token will have an expiry, and it will be valid only for the scope for which the consent has been provided by the customer. You can call the APIs by passing this token in Authorization header.
You also get a refresh token that can be used to get a new access token in case the original one expires. Authorization code grant: Retrieve access token

con:parameter.con:name: Authorization
con:parameter.con:description: HTTP Basic authentication by passing base64 encoded value of the client id and client secret separated by colon (:).Example: Base64(client_id:client_secret) will be passed as Basic KGNsaWVudF9pZDpjbGllbnRfc2VjcmV0KQ==

con:parameter.con:name: Content-Type
con:parameter.con:description: Value should always be application/x-www-form-urlencoded

con:parameter.con:name: grant_type
con:parameter.con:description: Authentication grant type. Valid value is authorization_code

con:parameter.con:name: code
con:parameter.con:description: The code from the response of GET /authCode/oauth2/authorize

con:parameter.con:name: redirect_uri
con:parameter.con:description: Absolute uri for user-agent redirection. You should provide the uri passed in GET /authCode/oauth2/authorize request

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This API will be the first step of MFA flow for third party client applications using authorization code grant. When the app tries to access a post-login resource and gets a 403 error response with error code "mfaRequired", it should make a GET call to redirect user to Citi MFA Validation Page. The page has all the OTP options available for the user and requires user interaction to select their preferred OTP option. Once selected, user may enter OTP obtained either via SMS or Hardware/Software Token on the next screen. On the successful OTP validation, user will be redirected back to the client application with mfa status as success. If user cancels OTP validation or any service error is encountered, the flow will be redirected back to the client application with appropriate error message. Multi-Factor Authentication

con:parameter.con:name: client_id
con:parameter.con:description: Client ID generated during application registration.

con:parameter.con:name: mfaCode
con:parameter.con:description: A valid mfa security token received in the 403 error response of the functional API call. Example KGNsaWVudF9pZDpjbGllbnRfc2VjcmV0KQ==

con:parameter.con:name: redirect_uri
con:parameter.con:description: Absolute uri for user-agent redirection. You should provide the uri used during client registration process.

con:parameter.con:name: state
con:parameter.con:description: Opaque value to maintain the state between request and call back. This will be used to prevent cross-site request forgery.

con:interface.name: Pay With Points
con:interface.con:description: The Pay with Points API lets Citi customers use their Citi Points to pay for all or part of a transaction on your app. To simplify integration, transaction payments are processed through your existing payment gateway. A matching statement credit is then applied to the customer's Citi account, usually within 1-3 days.

con:parameter.con:description: Applicable for credit cards only. This is a reference data field. Please use /v1/apac/utilities/referenceData/{transactionStatus} resource to get possible value of this field with description. You can use the field name as the referenceCode parameter to retrieve the values.

con:parameter.con:description: In some cases there is more data than what can be returned in a single response. If there is additional data available a nextStartIndex will be returned. Pass the nextStartIndex in your next request to retrieve the next set of data.

con:parameter.con:name: requestSize
con:parameter.con:description: Requested number of transactions.The maximum we can provide in one response is 50. If nothing is specified, we will return 20. Currently this field is not supported.

con:parameter.con:name: transactionFromDate
con:parameter.con:description: Starting range for transaction date in ISO 8601 date format 'YYYY-MM-DD'. Date Range: Upto last 12 months for CASA and last 3 Billing Cycle for credit card and ready credit accounts. Note :Applicable for advance search for CASA / Ready Credt / Credit Card account products

con:parameter.con:name: transactionToDate
con:parameter.con:description: End range for transaction date in ISO 8601 date format 'YYYY-MM-DD'. Date Range: Upto last 12 months for CASA and last 3 Billing Cycle for credit card and ready credit accounts. Note :Applicable for advance search for CASA / Ready Credt / Credit Card account products

con:parameter.con:name: amountFrom
con:parameter.con:description: Starting range of transaction amount. Note: Applicable for Investment accounts

con:parameter.con:name: amountTo

con:parameter.con:description: The account identifier in encrypted format.Typically, this is not displayed to the customer.

con:parameter.con:description: Applicable for credit cards only. This is a reference data field. Please use /v1/apac/utilities/referenceData/{transactionStatus} resource to get possible value of this field with description. You can use the field name as the referenceCode parameter to retrieve the values.

con:parameter.con:name: nextStartIndex
con:parameter.con:description: In some cases there is more data than what can be returned in a single response. If there is additional data available a nextStartIndex will be returned. Pass the nextStartIndex in your next request to retrieve the next set of data.

con:parameter.con:name: requestSize
con:parameter.con:description: Requested number of transactions.The maximum we can provide in one response is 50. If nothing is specified, we will return 20. Currently this field is not supported.

con:parameter.con:name: transactionFromDate
con:parameter.con:description: Starting range for transaction date in ISO 8601 date format 'YYYY-MM-DD'. Date Range: Upto last 12 months for CASA and last 3 Billing Cycle for credit card and ready credit accounts. Note :Applicable for advance search for CASA / Ready Credt / Credit Card account products

con:parameter.con:name: transactionToDate
con:parameter.con:description: End range for transaction date in ISO 8601 date format 'YYYY-MM-DD'. Date Range: Upto last 12 months for CASA and last 3 Billing Cycle for credit card and ready credit accounts. Note :Applicable for advance search for CASA / Ready Credt / Credit Card account products

con:parameter.con:name: amountFrom
con:parameter.con:description: Starting range of transaction amount. Note: Applicable for Investment accounts

con:parameter.con:name: amountTo
con:parameter.con:description: End range of transaction amount. Note: Applicable for Investment accounts

con:method.name: ViewTransactionDetailsDocument
con:method.con:description: This API is used to check the customer's eligibility for availing Balance Transfer. It is also used to provide eligible payment plans. Download Transaction Details

con:parameter.con:name: Authorization
con:parameter.con:description: The most recent Authorization token. This will have the format Bearer + {space} + {accessToken}. Example: Bearer KGNsaWVudF9pZDpjbGllbnRfc2VjcmV0KQ==.

con:parameter.con:name: uuid
con:parameter.con:description: 128 bit random UUID generated uniquely for every request.

con:parameter.con:name: Accept
con:parameter.con:description: Content-Type that are acceptable for the response.

con:parameter.con:name: client_id
con:parameter.con:description: Client ID generated during application registration.

con:parameter.con:name: clientDetails
con:parameter.con:description: This field is used to capture device,browser and network information. Refer the developer portal for more information.These are the fields which will be passed as part of the header devicePrint,deviceTokenCookie,userIpAddress,userAgent,hardwareId,simId,deviceModel,deviceName,deviceOsName,deviceOsVersion,multitaskingSupportFlag,languageSupport,wifiMacAddress,cellTowerId,locationAreaCode,rsaApplicationKey,wapClientId,mobileCarrierCode,mobileCountryCode,osId,geoLongitude,geoLatitude,geoHorizontalAccuracy,geoAltitude,geoAltitudeAccuracy,geoSpeed,geoTimestamp,geoStatus,basicServiceSetId,signalStrength,wifiChannel,serviceSetId

con:parameter.con:name: accountId

con:parameter.con:name: downloadFormat
con:parameter.con:description: This field refer to the fomat in which transaction detials is require to be downloaded. This is a reference data field. Please use /v1/utilities/referenceData/{downloadFormat} resource to get valid value of this field with description.

con:parameter.con:name: transactionStartDate
con:parameter.con:description: Starting range for transaction date in ISO 8601 date format 'YYYY-MM-DD'.

con:parameter.con:name: transactionEndDate
con:parameter.con:description: End range for transaction date in ISO 8601 date format 'YYYY-MM-DD'.

con:parameter.con:name: nextStartIndex
con:parameter.con:description: In some cases there is more data than what can be returned in a single response. If there is additional data available a nextStartIndex will be returned. Pass the nextStartIndex in your next request to retrieve the next set of data.
